abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Policy Based Guarantee
            (PBG) Project for Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was moderate; Bank performance was satisfactory and
            borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned includes: the PBG instrument proved to be a
            successful instrument for leveraging additional resources
            for the client. FYR Macedonia would have been unable to
            raise a loan of this size without the PBG. Due to its
            improved leverage of Bank assets, the PBG is a viable and
            potentially more powerful policy-based financing tool than a
            Development Policy Loan (DPL). The PBG has proven to be a
            useful instrument, in particular with the current incentive
            structure. The instrument might be of particular benefit to
            smaller countries, for which the leveraging ability of this
            instrument might be of higher importance than for bigger
            ones. The program permitted adequate flexibility to account
            for responses to changing circumstances, especially during
            times of crisis.
